website_summaries.verdict: An extremely sharp tool made of quality steel. Little engineering touches place this contender a cut above others.
pros: Tangs extend to the handles, creating a solid, comfortable grip
Great for removing bark and other wood-related tasks
cons: Rare cosmetic complaints about the blade

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good, but finish doesn't match the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a workmanlike tool, but the price is excessive for what you get - a simple single bevel (very coarse) grind, some unsanded handles, and that's about it. The design is about right for heavier work, though the blade could fill a bit more of the space between the handles. For lighter or more accurate work, you will need to spend a ton of time bringing the edge up to spec.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K.

customer_reviews.title: Not polished - deep grind marks
customer_reviews.text: 1 star for quick delivery - 1 star for quality hard steel, 1 star for handle stability - 0 star for blade flatness - 0 star for deep grind marks in the entire blade - over all 3 stars. Be prepared to do some serious honing and sharpening. will take hours to get it perfectly flat and get the grind marks out of the cutting edge. This blade was NOT polished or refined. See images, almost rough enough to be used as a file.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is the only draw-knife I ever bought or used, so my experience is limited. It was sharp when I unpacked it, and used it to strip bark from a large oak limb that I planned to carve. Once I got into the right angle and rhythm, it worked amazingly well. As for any knife, I found that honing it now and then restores the edge. If you haven't done it before, I strongly recommend viewing some YouTube videos about honing a draw knife or similar tool. It isn't very hard and will give you pleasure to maintain your tool. I would definitely recommend this to anyone shopping for a draw-knife.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K

customer_reviews.title: Took some time to sharpen and hone but once I did it kept a wonderful edge. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I don't expect hand tools to come honed to a mirror finish, very few do, and you will pay for that. This item came about as rough as could be, straight of the grinder. Took some time to sharpen and hone but once I did it kept a wonderful edge. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Hawks' Field

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This product was everything described. A very well made draw shave fron Ox-Head. My only problem with this is honestly it didnt come very sharp, Im sure that I can put a decent edge on it, but my Gransfors Bruks carpenters hatchet is way sharper. My draw shave that I recieved did have some (small) tooling marks on it, not a big deal, im sure it may have more as the years go by. All in all a decent draw shave, well made, just could have been sharper. Next time Ill just spend the extra money and get one from Gransfors Bruks
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Finally a tool tough tool!
customer_reviews.text: Tool tough. Blade holds great edge, came sharp. Handles have not loosed up despite vigorous use on foraged logs for debarking. Overall, this drawknife looks good and works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Pyra Gorgon

customer_reviews.title: Love this blade
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product: it holds its edge from repeated use, it flattens logs easily, and it feels good to use in the hand. If you're looking for a blade to turn some wet round logs into planks for bushcraft construction, give this a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, not terribly sharp out of the box, but that is a easy fix. Better quality than other drawknives I've used. I plan on refinishing the handles as I am not a fan of painted and shelac for handles.
customer_reviews.author: ang

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good on spruce up to 14" diameter
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good on spruce up to 14" diameter. Not as beefy as expected by works good. Have not tried it on hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: Jess a.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quailty draw knife for the money. It did not come close to sharp. The handles and steel are good. Sharpen it up and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Durig

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: A great hand tool that works great. Seems to be made of good material, the blade holds a good edge. I always clean and oil my good wood working tools. This falls in the same category as my other wood working tools.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky S.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for the price. Took a fair amount of work to flatten the back, due to a low spot near the edge. Bevel was pretty clean, so easy enough to sharpen and hone. Haven’t given it a hard workout, but happy with test cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: best drawknife around.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. came fairly sharp took some time to put a better edge on it, but it holds a razor sharp edge for a long time. handles are mounted securely with no wiggle. overall i recommend this product for anyone looking for a drawknife.
customer_reviews.author: dan walker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: should not give you a 5 star because its going to take some work to sharpen it up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grip and use was very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is the BOMB!!! Stripped 5 6' posts right out of the box. Took off knots and bark clean and smooth. Sharp and ready to use on arrival!!!! Grip and use was very nice!!! Would highly recommend this tool to everyone!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Pfaff

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality drawknife
customer_reviews.text: excellent quality draw knife. Does need a finer honed edge when you get it, but does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Strom

customer_reviews.title: bought this based on other reviews and have to say pulled the bark off super easy, and if you flip it
customer_reviews.text: So far I am impressed, decided to start carving Tiki's as a hobby and know nothing about the tools required, bought this based on other reviews and have to say pulled the bark off super easy, and if you flip it, you can pull paper thin strips of wood off. so far, super impressed
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality tool. The blade came fairly sharp and the handles seem very stout. I honed the blade with minimal effort and it is extremely sharp now. I love the ergonomics of the curved handles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for debarking
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this drawknife to debark limbs from a semi-green white oak in northeast Indiana. I'm using the limbs for stair rail spindles. It's a sharp as one could ask for and does the job as I intended and expected. I've completed two limbs no problems. I would definately recommend it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Boiler Up!

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine, this is my first draw knife so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems fine, this is my first draw knife so I don't know what to compare it to. It dulls much quicker than I thought. I pretty much have to sharpen it every 5 minutes when stripping bark.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Great draw knife! The backwards bevel was different at first but works wonderful. Works good for logs under 12"
customer_reviews.author: zach wedekind

customer_reviews.title: The knife performs well, and met my expectations. ...
customer_reviews.text: The knife performs well, and met my expectations. 4 stars due to the fact that I had to spend a lot of time with a sharpening stone to dress up the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oh head straight draw knife
customer_reviews.text: I do like the drawknife. I have only tried it on lodgepole pine trees and it did the trick. This knife works cuts easy and is comfortable for me to use. The only downside to the knife is that it needs sharpening fairly often however for the price I believe it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good Knife For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I am just getting into making log furniture and was told to make sure I buy a draw knife from anywhere but China. This one is made in Germany and seems to do a pretty good job, granted I don't have any other knife to compare it to. It stripped bark no problem, even broke through some knots. I used it to whittle a few logs down so they fit in my tenon cutters too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M. Rappel

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: The knife doesn't look exactly like the picture but it works very well. I use the draw knife to make bows and so far it works very well! It can cut through knots and stumps from branches pretty quickly. It seems like it won't break easily and it should last a long time. It definitely works better than a knife for making bows. I would recommend it to anyone that does woodwork. I took away one star because it is a little expensive and it isn't perfect but still it is very useful to have.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Well crafted. Holds a sharp edge well. The large handles enhance the accuracy and aid in holding without the need to maintain a tight grip.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT drawknife
customer_reviews.text: GREAT drawknife. I use it to make windsor chairs from green oak lumber. Holds an edge exceptionally. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Thornflesh

customer_reviews.title: Ox-Head 9" Drawknife
customer_reviews.text: As received this drawknife will not cut even by accident, but after some time with sharpening stones a fine edge and polish that is reasonably long lasting can be obtained. I purchased the knife to debark cypress logs and to prepare them for further carving. For the price this is a good tool if you are willing to spend some time finishing it.
customer_reviews.author: jdp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice high quality produce with good steel in it. Worked great on my projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Well made German tool
customer_reviews.text: Very solid build and sharp, works great at removing even thick bark.
customer_reviews.author: ChristianT

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good draw knife, sharp, well balanced and crafted, easy to control and more than adequate for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Blaise

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This blade is awesome right out of the box. It cut the bark off of some black Walnut logs like it was slicing through butter.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.C35

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Ox-Head Drawknife
customer_reviews.text: Well shaped and sturdy tool. Good design for a strong pull. Worked well for my project shaping a large log.
customer_reviews.author: WADilger

customer_reviews.title: Actually hand made products are produced
customer_reviews.text: The tool is everything as advertised plus. The drawknife arrived ahead of schedule, and was in perfect condition. I shave green white oak and ash, and the drawknife does a marvelous job.
customer_reviews.author: Retired fly fisher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Starting a new hobby and bought this draw-knife. I was surprised how durable it is.
customer_reviews.author: MartyMar

customer_reviews.title: German quality and a great buy in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality. Maybe 4 stars? Blade hade a decent sharp grind on it. No scratches or guages. German quality and a great buy in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Andersen

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: seems to keep an edge well, decent construction, not rust proof so keep it oiled if you want it clean
customer_reviews.author: Seth Larson

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and strong! Does great job of remove the bark off logs. I have used it for only a few logs so far, but it seems to be keeping its blade sharp - I haven't had to resharpen it yet!
customer_reviews.author: ChesterCG

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice knife. Good quality & sharp right out of the box. Would be nice if it came with a blade guard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: This drawknife was shipped with deep grinding marks on all surfaces. If was not finished, let alone sharp. Several hours work with sandpaper (120 grit!!) mounted on blocks removed most but not all of the grinding marks and produced an edge that was somewhat usable. Several more hours of work will be required to make this tool into what it should have been when it was shipped. The steel from which the tool is made sems to warrant the work to produce a good tool, but I can say little for the manufacturer other than the right steel was used. J.R,. Wilt
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: FALSE STATEMENTS in the desription
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday and was totally disappointed with the blade surface finish and hence the sharpness. The one i received clearly came directly from the coarse grinder and had very deep grind marks. After over 1 hour of polishing it is in acceptable shape now, but i still was not able to completely remove all the grind scratches. I would say it is fairly well made, but to read in the description "Cutting edges finely polished for the best cutting performance" is just simply a FALSE statement. I think the reseller or the manufacturer owes us something here (like one that really is polished). If they don't improve this i would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B.

customer_reviews.title: Good drawknife
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little conflicted about the star rating. Could not decide between 3 or 4 stars but after using it it's my impression the steel is good and it will be a workhorse, so that decided the four stars. The appearance is kind of drab and the grind, while accurate, is really rough. It takes some serious work with a stone to make it usable.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: drawknife
customer_reviews.text: very sharp when we got. has worked very well. easy to use and very simple. takes off what you need and very efficiently too. very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality drawknife... the edge came sharp and is easy to keep that way..... I expect many years use from it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: So good, it deserved a great review!
customer_reviews.text: The heft and balance of this draw knife is perfect. I have been debarking spruce logs for railings and stair spindles. I can work for several hours at a time because it is heavy enough to cut small limbs, and light enough to do careful, intricate work. Steel holds its blade. I use a stone puck with oil for sharpening. It is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Scot M. Ioset

customer_reviews.title: Great Father's Day Gift
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Ox-Head Drawknife for my husband's Father's Day present as he had wanted one for a long while. Not knowing what in the world I was looking for, I should have known to go to Amazon.com and I would find it. Well, it was a hit - just what he wanted. He even had me come to his shop so he could show me how the drawknife was used. I can assure you that you made one Father very happy on his day. Thanks so much for the quick delivery and the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine R, Pearl, MS

customer_reviews.title: Very decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Better construction than some others offered at higher prices. While the factory edge needs improvement, it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: woolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Product worked great right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great right out of the box. This is my first time using a draw knife but it is better than I expected. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: petecrysTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. So sturdy and well made. I look forward to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S Mejia

customer_reviews.title: it worked great. Holds an edge nicely and is easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: I do not do a lot of skinning of logs, but for the project I purchased this knife for, it worked great. Holds an edge nicely and is easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: Finally found one
customer_reviews.text: Works great didn't think I would ever find one again thanks!!!! Have had so much fun using it cam fast and at a great prince. Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: Mindjacked

customer_reviews.title: Great drawknife!
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product. Out of the box it is sharp enough for most projects, and it holds an edge very well. It had some very minor pits in the blade, but those were easily fixed with some sharpening. The handles are relatively comfortable and provide a good grip. This is a great tool for the home woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: David Gethings

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item has held up well so far I have used it on enough logs to build a cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack9

customer_reviews.title: High quality.
customer_reviews.text: As expected, high quality product. Good edge right from the start. Easily sharpened with a stone. German steel can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J. Heffner

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, sharp and well balanced. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lake Pilot

customer_reviews.title: ... first experience using a draw knife and we're very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is our first experience using a draw knife and we're very happy with the purchase. The knife easily removes bark from logs and we're looking forward to incorporating the finished products to our home.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the picture...
customer_reviews.text: The reason I "don't like it" is that the one in the picture has nicely angles handles, which was my main reason for choosing it. The one I got has straight handles instead, which I specifically did not want. The ergonomics are important to me and if it had resembled the one in the pic, I would give it four stars. If it also came with sheath and a little sharper, I would rate it 5. As it sits, not quite what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Ian S

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves this...
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this drawknife. He uses it to skin bark.
customer_reviews.author: Biddy Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro but this is worth the money. Looked at cheap ones and bought this quality product.
customer_reviews.author: shannon mcdaniel

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for bark removal
customer_reviews.text: I used this tool to remove bark from several stumps. It made the job go a lot easier and would recommend for anyone doing a similar project.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy K Steach

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Sure have enjoyed using this drawknife. Main use is taking the bark off of Bois D'Arc tree staves that I plan to turn into longbows. I've touched up the edge a couple of times but it has worked great and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shinbone

customer_reviews.title: I used it as soon as it arrived.
customer_reviews.text: I used it as soon as it arrived. I didn't even have to sharpen it before using it & it stays sharp for awhile
customer_reviews.author: Monica Torres

customer_reviews.title: Gets it done
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st but works well , keeps an edge and does what I need it too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drawknife by Oxhead
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Very sharp out of the box and seems like great quality steel. Have peeled pine logs with ease using the draw knife.
customer_reviews.author: loyal

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Handles are little small and stubby, not like they show in the picture. But overall it is a good product. It will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: John Crites

customer_reviews.title: Decent Item
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent item, although it did not come real sharp. Nothing I cant remedy. Steel nice and thick, handles firm. All in all, a good tool. I would assume any drawknife like this would need additional sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Ox-head 8 3/4" Curved Drawknife
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty look and feel.Very sharp out of the box. Easy to use never having used one before. Used it on several 4' sections of a small tree I took down. I would reccomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DanD

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a cheap, made in china tool. I'm very please with it. some of the other reviews were negative, but for the price it's very well made. From the pictures I was afraid of the handle not being attached well. No worries though!
customer_reviews.author: pvcwizard

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery, good product, and good price. This knife performs very well and remains sharp through a lot of use. Very good product for the price. I would recommend this drawknife to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good quality blade
customer_reviews.text: The product came in very good conditions. The blade is sharpened already. Overall ergonomics of the product are very good. Although I would have preferred to have wooden handles they are made out of plastic. Shipping on time, no delays.
customer_reviews.author: Mihai Buleu

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good value works well and hope I ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good value works well and hope I find it retains edge. Only thing better would be to have a protective sheath. Vendor represented correctly and shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: John Drennen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: seems to have worked well, only used it one time.
customer_reviews.author: motocephalic

customer_reviews.title: Gift was well received.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and the person we gave it to seems to love it. Sorry I can't give anyone my own personal experience with it but it did seem to be a solid tool that could last years if properly cared for.
customer_reviews.author: FishTech

customer_reviews.title: Solid Draw Knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife to use on solid wood, rustic furniture - in this case a cedar tree lamp stand. I wanted to take off bark AND do some light detail work. I did need to work on the edge a little when it came (in two days thanks to Amazon Prime Awesomeness) but then, any tool I've purchased that has an edge needs a little work out of the box. After several hours of busting through knots and peeling the soft flesh of the cedar tree, it was still good and sharp. I really like this tool and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: I love this draw knife
customer_reviews.text: I love this draw knife. The handles are wood, not plastic as some have stated and it is well balanced and sharp. Love it and so does my husband although I will be the main user.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Kelso

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, but I don't like that there is no sheath. I don't use it enough to keep it out and kids around the house and this needs a blade guard!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Sher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Drawknife for Hickory / Oak Debarking Walking Sticks
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, sharp, quality .... Does nice job on my walking sticks creationsa and the chairs I made from limbs .... Handles well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Transformed a chore into fun
customer_reviews.text: I had a number of logs that I needed to peel for rustic-looking trim work in a cabin. This log peeler (sorry, drawknife) works great on lodgepole pine (and some other pine varieties I had around). It's actually a lot of fun to use, glides really easy and peels nice, thin strips off the log. You can even smooth out minor irregularities if your wood isn't too hard. Appears to be Made in Germany.
customer_reviews.author: CoonCreek

customer_reviews.title: Nice draw-knife, sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice draw-knife, sharp and easy to use. Drawback, I had to repair the handle after a couple hours of use. Was disappointed,
customer_reviews.author: NICE77

customer_reviews.title: Not Finished Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tool, once you get it up and running. The tooling marks on the blade were terrible. I took me 2 hours with a course DMT diamond file to get it smooth. Parts of it have deep pitting that will never get smooth. It's like some was falling onto a grinder and they used my drawknife to break the fall. All that being said it’s a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: NICE!
customer_reviews.text: I made a heavy leather sheath for it before sharpening to a razor edge, VERY good steel in this product.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Good metal that takes a good edge but should be sent out with a polished honed edge from the factory,
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use to build some log furniture and for the price it is a quality piece of metal. It came in a semi-sharp condition but due to good steel I was able to hone a perfect edge on it rather quickly. It will take a few sharpenings to remove the mill marks from the cutting edge. I would think they would send these out with a nicely polished honed edge....
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drawknife
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased this knife to debark spruce trees. The knife was very sharp and ready to use out of the package. It was easy to use and the job was quickly done.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: ... and I know that I will get a lot good use out of the Drawknife
customer_reviews.text: It was as expected and I know that I will get a lot good use out of the Drawknife.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, don't waste your money on a cheap one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It'll be a Christmas gift ... hope it works well for them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality. The substantial nature, and quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality. The substantial nature, and quality of construction doesn't come through in the photos. This will last many lifetimes.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Nye

customer_reviews.title: SHARP!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent draw knife and very sharp! This one is of very high-quality manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: IDA CBer

product_meta.title: Ox-Head 10" x 1-3/8" Straight Drawknife, OX3752500
product_meta.description:
Size:10-Inch x 1-3/8-Inch StraightFROM THE MANUFACTURER
Ox-Head hatchets and axes have been manufactured in Wuppertal, Germany since 1781. The name is synonymous with quality and functional beauty among foresters, carpenters and boat builders world-wide. Each axe is expertly and carefully manufactured to the highest standards. Particular attention is paid to careful hardening of the steels, which accounts for the long-lasting sharpness in Ox-Head tools.
feature_bullets: Made in Germany from special quality tool steel
Cutting edges finely polished for the best cutting performance
The tangs extend fully through the handles, for a strong, secure grip
Used to debark logs plus other more specialized tasks which require the rapid removal of wood

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars153 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
